medical_history.chief_complaint: Retching for 1 week and worsening condition for 2 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with retching for 1 week and worsened over the last 2 days. The child experienced poor appetite, poor sleep, fair mental status, and reduced urine output during this time. No other significant gastrointestinal or respiratory symptoms were noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The child was hospitalized previously for neonatal hyperbilirubinemia, neonatal bilirubin encephalopathy, congenital hepatic cyst, and congenital bilateral renal multiple cysts. Anemia was detected at 8 months, treated with oral medication and dietary therapy.
